chart of tenses with sentence example

Present Past Future
simple/indefinite
  • she goes to school.
  • she goes not go to school.
  • does she go to school?
  • why does she go to school?
    		•
  • she went to school.
  • she did not go to school.
  • did she go to school.
  • why did she go to school.
    		•
  • she will go to school.
  • she will not go to school.
  • will she go to school?
  • why will she go to school?
    		•
    continues
  • she is going to school.
  • she is not going to school.
  • is she going to school?
  • why is she going to school?
    		•
  • she was going to school.
  • she was not going to school.
  • was she going to school?
  • why was she going to school?
    		•
  • she will be going to school.
  • she will not be going to school.
  • will she be going to school?
  • why will she be going to school?
    		•
    perfect
  • she has gone to school.
  • she has not gone to school.
  • has she gone to school?
  • why has she gone to school?
  • why has she gone to school?
    		•
  • she had gone to school?
  • she had not gone to school.
  • had she gone to school?
  • why had she gone to school?
    		•
  • she will have gone to school.
  • she will not have gone to school?
  • why will she have gone to school?
    		•
    perfect continues
  • she has been going to school.
  • she has not been going to school.
  • has she been going to school?
  • why has she been going to school?
    		•
  • she had not been going to school.
  • she had not been going to school.
  • had she been going to school?
  • why had she been going to school?
  • she will have been going to school.
  • she will have not been going to school.
  • will she have been going to school?
  • why will she have been going to school?
    		•
